Description: Rim and wall sherd of South Ionian pottery skyphos; interior: glazed black with added red lines; exterior; lip black with red bands; handle zone reserved with dotted cross and billet pattern; below, glazed black with narrow red line; inscription on exterior.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.757 and Oxford AN1925.608g.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 741, no. 1005)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (p. 131, no. 503, pl. 54, no. 503)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 124, no. 350.3, pl. XXXVIII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.882)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.6004 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
